title: Drawing, "Sketches for scenes 1 and 2 of the cartoon for cotton printing: The History of Henry IV [L'Histoire de Henri IV]", ca. 1820
inscribed: Inscription in pencil in the artist's hand: "groupe/ coin a droite/ repare ager/ la coin a gauche/ du bas" (right center), and quoatation from Voltaire's text (bottom left and right).
description: Scene from Voltaire's epic, "Henriade".  Henry IV seated in a landscape near the Port of Dieppe, with his friend, Duplessis-Mornay, converses with a holy hermit (Canto I, lines 229-232).

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches for scenes 1 and 2 of the cartoon for cotton printing: The History of Henry IV [L'Histoire de Henri IV]", ca. 1820.
ca. 1820. Pencil on cream-colored paper. Gift of Bridget Mahon. 1898-21-21-a.
